title: Can People See If You View Their LinkedIn? Complete Guide

steps.title: Yes, LinkedIn notifies users when you look at their profile.
steps.content: Yes, LinkedIn notifies users when you look at their profile. However, the information shown depends on the type of account the user has. If the user has a free LinkedIn account, there are a few limitations that may prevent them from seeing your notification. If the user has a premium LinkedIn account, they will have enhanced visibility when it comes to who's viewing their profile. When talking about direct messages, LinkedIn will send read receipts to the other user unless you have it turned off . If you don't want users to know you viewed their profile, you can easily set your profile to browse in private mode . Alternatively, you can sign out of LinkedIn.

steps.title: All LinkedIn users can see who viewed their profile.
steps.content: All LinkedIn users can see who viewed their profile. However, free members and premium members have different perks. If the user has a free LinkedIn account and has viewers constantly, they may have missed your notification. The current limitations are as follows: Free LinkedIn Members : You can see the last 5 people who viewed your profile Some users may appear as LinkedIn Member , Someone in the Marketing Industry , or another anonymous way. You can only see users who visited in the last 90 days. Premium LinkedIn Members : You can see who viewed your profile in the past 90 days or year, depending on your plan. You can see detailed analytics about your profile viewers, including company, industry, location, and other demographics. You can see who viewed your profile even when in Private Mode.

steps.title: Navigate to LinkedIn.
steps.content: Navigate to LinkedIn. You can use LinkedIn in a web browser or the mobile app. If you aren't already logged in, enter your account information now.

steps.title: Select Me.
steps.content: Select Me . On a computer, this is in the top toolbar. On mobile, this is your profile picture in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Select View Profile.
steps.content: Select View Profile . This is in the drop-down menu. If you're using the mobile app, skip this step.

steps.title: Select Show all analytics.
steps.content: Select Show all analytics . On mobile, this will look like View all analytics .

steps.title: View your viewer list.
steps.content: View your viewer list. Select a category underneath the Analytics header to view it. If you have a Premium account, you'll be able to see more in-depth analytics.

steps.title: Navigate to LinkedIn.
steps.content: Navigate to LinkedIn. You can use LinkedIn in a web browser or the mobile app. If you aren't already logged in, enter your account information now. Private Mode will hide your LinkedIn profile details from others when viewing their profile. Instead of your name, they will see Anonymous LinkedIn Member . Keep in mind that setting Private Mode will make you unable to see who viewed your own profile and erase your current viewer history. If you don't want to set this mode, you can simply log out of LinkedIn to view any profile anonymously.

steps.title: Select Me.
steps.content: Select Me . On a computer, this is in the top toolbar. On mobile, this is your profile picture in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Select Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Select Settings & Privacy . This is in the drop-down menu. If you're using the mobile app, you'll select Settings .

steps.title: Select Visibility.
steps.content: Select Visibility . This is next to the eye icon. You'll see this underneath Sign in & security .

steps.title: Select Profile viewing options.
steps.content: Select Profile viewing options . This is the first option underneath the Visibility of your profile & network header.

steps.title: Select Private mode.
steps.content: Select Private mode . This is the third option. You should see a bubble next to the option. Your changes will be saved. You'll no longer be able to see your own profile view history and any existing history will be erased.

steps.title: Navigate to LinkedIn.
steps.content: Navigate to LinkedIn. You can use LinkedIn in a web browser or the mobile app. If you aren't already logged in, enter your account information now. If you don't want other users to see when you've read their message, you can disable read receipts. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select Me.
steps.content: Select Me . On desktop, this is in the top toolbar. On mobile, this is your profile picture in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Select Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Select Settings & Privacy . This is in the drop-down menu. If you're using the mobile app, you'll select Settings .

steps.title: Select Data privacy.
steps.content: Select Data privacy . You can find this underneath Visibility .

steps.title: Select Read receipts and typing indicators.
steps.content: Select Read receipts and typing indicators . This is underneath the Messaging experience header. You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Toggle off "Delivery indicators".
steps.content: Toggle off "Delivery indicators". The switch will turn white. Typing indicators and read receipts are now disabled.

steps.title: Premium users have more detailed view features.
steps.content: Premium users have more detailed view features. While you can see who viewed your profile with a free or Premium account, you can get access to more features such as demographics, company, location, and more with a Premium account. If you have a free account, you can only see the last 5 people who viewed your profile. Keep in mind that you can't see views from users that have Private Mode enabled. If you have a Premium account, you can enable Private Mode to hide your views on other profiles while maintaining your own profile view history. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Connect with recruiters or hiring teams.
steps.content: Connect with recruiters or hiring teams. If you're looking for a job, using your viewers list is a great way to acknowledge a user's profile visit. It could mean they're interested in you as a candidate for an opening, and sending a message can be a great way to show interest in the company. If your profile is updated , you can even showcase your expertise.

steps.title: Develop your business.
steps.content: Develop your business. Knowing your audience can help you look for potential clients. If people are viewing your profile, they may be interested in what you have to offer. You can use your viewers list to reach out with personalized messages as soon as possible.

steps.title: Network with others.
steps.content: Network with others. If your work is dependent on networking, seeing your viewers list can help you follow up with other users. They may be interested in your skills, have a shared interest, or have mutual connections with others in the field.

steps.title: Does LinkedIn notify you when someone views your profile?
steps.content: Does LinkedIn notify you when someone views your profile? LinkedIn can send notifications when someone views your profile. This is dependent on your privacy and device settings. The user must also not be in Private Mode when viewing your profile.

steps.title: Can you see if someone views your profile more than once?
steps.content: Can you see if someone views your profile more than once? If you have a Premium LinkedIn account, you may see the same user appear in your viewer history more than once. This usually indicates that they visited your page multiple times. If you have a regular, free LinkedIn account, the user may only appear once. Each separate visit counts as a new view in a user's analytics.

steps.title: How accurate are LinkedIn profile views?
steps.content: How accurate are LinkedIn profile views? LinkedIn profile views are generally accurate, but bugs can occur and affect the data. Rather than depending on precise numbers, try analyzing trends and demographics in your audience instead.

steps.title: How do I turn off LinkedIn profile view?
steps.content: How do I turn off LinkedIn profile view? To disable profile view on LinkedIn, navigate to your settings and select Visibility . Select the option for Private mode .

steps.title: How do I turn off LinkedIn profile view notifications?
steps.content: How do I turn off LinkedIn profile view notifications? To disable notifications on LinkedIn, navigate to your settings and select Notifications . From there, select Profile viewing options and disable it.
